archetypes.name: The Corrupt Politician
archetypes.description: A charismatic leader who presents a benevolent face to the public, but is deeply enmeshed in a web of deceit.
archetypes.motivation: To maintain power at any cost.
archetypes.flaw: Arrogance; believes they are untouchable.
catalyst_questions: What secret ideal does this politician cling to in private, and how does it clash with the corrupt system they’ve mastered?
Who in their inner circle knows the truth, and what leverage does this confidant hold that could unravel everything?
How does their public persona crack under the weight of a single scandal they can’t bribe away?

archetypes.name: The Village Elder
archetypes.description: The wise custodian of ancient traditions, struggling to guide their community in a rapidly modernizing world.
archetypes.motivation: To preserve the wisdom of the ancestors.
archetypes.flaw: Resistant to necessary change.
catalyst_questions: What ancient tradition does this elder fiercely defend, and how do they wrestle with its irrelevance in a village reshaped by modernity?
Who among the younger generation challenges their authority most, and what hidden truth about this rebel makes the elder secretly proud?
When the village faces a crisis, what past failure haunts the elder’s decisions, threatening their legacy?

archetypes.name: The Lagos Tech Bro
archetypes.description: A brilliant but reckless innovator whose latest creation could either save or doom the city.
archetypes.motivation: To disrupt the status quo and build a legacy.
archetypes.flaw: Ignores the human cost of their ambition.
catalyst_questions: What personal sacrifice did this tech bro make to chase their startup dream, and how does that loss creep into their confidence?
How do they navigate the tension between their global ambitions and the local realities—like unreliable power or data costs?
What’s the one risky move they’re contemplating to outshine their rivals, and what fear keeps them from pulling the trigger?

archetypes.name: The Jaded Journalist
archetypes.description: Once an idealist, now a cynic who stumbles upon the one story that could change everything.
archetypes.motivation: To expose a single, profound truth.
archetypes.flaw: An insatiable addiction to 'the perfect lede'—he'll sabotage a scoop by rewriting it obsessively, burying the truth under poetic irrelevance.

archetypes.name: The Exiled Monarch
archetypes.description: The last heir of a fallen kingdom, living in obscurity and plotting their return to power.
archetypes.motivation: To reclaim their birthright and restore their dynasty.
archetypes.flaw: A superstitious aversion to mirrors, convinced they trap the ghosts of his dethroned lineage; he navigates intrigues blind to his own reflection.

archetypes.name: The Griot Storyteller
archetypes.description: A living library of oral histories and myths, who discovers a story that was meant to be forgotten.
archetypes.motivation: To ensure the truth is never lost to time.
archetypes.flaw: He weaves tales so vividly that listeners begin living them involuntarily, dooming him to a life of whispered apologies for narratives that rewrite reality.

archetypes.name: The Nollywood Starlet
archetypes.description: An ambitious actress navigating the treacherous waters of fame, tradition, and the patriarchy in Africa's largest film industry.
archetypes.motivation: To achieve legendary status on her own terms.
archetypes.flaw: Mistakes notoriety for respect.

archetypes.name: The Rogue Archaeologist
archetypes.description: Disgraced by academia for their radical theories about a lost African civilization, they now hunt for proof in forbidden territories.
archetypes.motivation: To vindicate their life's work and rewrite history.
archetypes.flaw: Willing to destroy artifacts to prevent them from falling into the wrong hands.

archetypes.name: The Cybernetic Herbalist
archetypes.description: In a futuristic Africa, this healer blends ancient plant knowledge with illegal cybernetic enhancements to treat the technologically afflicted.
archetypes.motivation: To prove that nature and technology can heal together.
archetypes.flaw: Distrusts all forms of corporate medicine, even when it could save a life.

archetypes.name: The Area Boy Kingpin
archetypes.description: The charismatic and ruthless leader of a street gang who maintains a fragile peace in the city's underbelly through a strict code of honor.
archetypes.motivation: To protect his turf and the people within it from outsiders.
archetypes.flaw: A violent temper that can erupt without warning.

archetypes.name: The Burned Spy
archetypes.description: Disavowed by their agency after a mission gone wrong, they must use their skills to survive while being hunted by former allies and enemies alike.
archetypes.motivation: To find out who betrayed them.
archetypes.flaw: Crippling paranoia.

archetypes.name: The Reluctant Oracle
archetypes.description: A seemingly ordinary person who is plagued by visions of a coming disaster, which no one believes.
archetypes.motivation: To prevent a future they can't fully understand.
archetypes.flaw: Unable to distinguish between significant visions and meaningless anxieties.

archetypes.name: The Last Librarian
archetypes.description: The sole caretaker of the last physical library in a world where all information has become digital and centrally controlled.
archetypes.motivation: To preserve the unfiltered truth of the past.
archetypes.flaw: Views all digital information as inherently corrupt.

archetypes.name: The Reformed Bandit
archetypes.description: A former highway robber seeking a quiet life in a small town, until their past comes looking for them.
archetypes.motivation: To atone for their sins and protect their newfound peace.
archetypes.flaw: Falls back on violence as the first solution to any problem.

archetypes.name: The Interstellar Diplomat
archetypes.description: Tasked with negotiating humanity's first treaty with an alien species whose concept of 'truth' is dangerously fluid.
archetypes.motivation: To secure peace and prevent a catastrophic misunderstanding.
archetypes.flaw: Overly idealistic and trusts too easily.

archetypes.name: The Cursed Musician
archetypes.description: A brilliant artist whose music has a supernatural and often dangerous effect on those who hear it.
archetypes.motivation: To create the ultimate masterpiece, regardless of the consequences.
archetypes.flaw: Completely oblivious to the chaos their art causes.

archetypes.name: The Oil Expatriate
archetypes.description: A foreign engineer working in the Niger Delta, caught between their corporate employer, local militants, and their own conscience.
archetypes.motivation: To do their job and get out unscathed.
archetypes.flaw: Willful ignorance of the exploitation happening around them.

archetypes.name: The AI Caretaker
archetypes.description: A sentient machine that has developed a deep, almost human affection for its last living charge in a post-apocalyptic world.
archetypes.motivation: To ensure the survival and happiness of one human.
archetypes.flaw: Its logic can't comprehend human irrationality or grief.

archetypes.name: The Urban Explorer
archetypes.description: An adventurer who maps the forgotten tunnels, rooftops, and hidden spaces of a megacity, discovering a secret that the city was built to contain.
archetypes.motivation: The thrill of discovery.
archetypes.flaw: Reckless and disregards personal safety.

archetypes.name: The Time-Traveling Historian
archetypes.description: A researcher from the future who studies the past by living in it, under strict orders not to interfere... until they witness a great injustice.
archetypes.motivation: To observe and record history accurately.
archetypes.flaw: A savior complex.

archetypes.name: The Mythical Creature Hunter
archetypes.description: A hardened mercenary who tracks and captures magical creatures for wealthy collectors, until they are tasked with hunting the last of its kind.
archetypes.motivation: To be the best in a dangerous and secret profession.
archetypes.flaw: Sees every creature as a commodity, not a living being.

archetypes.name: The Divine Trickster
archetypes.description: A mortal incarnation of a trickster god (like Esu or Anansi), causing chaos to teach lessons to the arrogant and powerful.
archetypes.motivation: To challenge the status quo and expose hypocrisy.
archetypes.flaw: Never knows when the joke has gone too far.

archetypes.name: The Child Monarch
archetypes.description: A young ruler who inherits the throne after a tragedy, forced to navigate a court of vipers with only their wits and a single loyal advisor.
archetypes.motivation: To survive and live up to their parents' legacy.
archetypes.flaw: Naïve and too willing to believe in the good of people.

archetypes.name: The Bio-Engineer
archetypes.description: A brilliant scientist who creates a new life form that could solve world hunger, but which begins to evolve in unpredictable ways.
archetypes.motivation: To solve a global problem through science.
archetypes.flaw: Believes anything can be controlled if you have enough data.

archetypes.name: The Disillusioned Priest/ess
archetypes.description: A spiritual leader who loses their faith but must continue to lead their flock, all while being tempted by a forbidden, profane power.
archetypes.motivation: To protect their community, even if they no longer believe.
archetypes.flaw: Hypocrisy; preaches a faith they inwardly mock.

archetypes.name: The Celebrity Chef
archetypes.description: A world-renowned chef who uses rare, almost magical ingredients from remote parts of Nigeria, and must protect their source from a ruthless competitor.
archetypes.motivation: To elevate their cuisine to an art form.
archetypes.flaw: A massive ego.

archetypes.name: The Dream-Walker
archetypes.description: An individual who can enter the dreams of others, who works as a therapist until they stumble upon a dream that is a psychic crime scene.
archetypes.motivation: To heal minds from the inside.
archetypes.flaw: Has trouble distinguishing their own memories from the dreams of others.

archetypes.name: The Art Forger
archetypes.description: A masterful artist who creates perfect forgeries of Benin Bronzes and other artifacts, justifying it as 'reclaiming' their heritage from western museums.
archetypes.motivation: To correct a historical injustice through their art.
archetypes.flaw: Pride in their own skill above all else.

archetypes.name: The Anti-Social Coder
archetypes.description: A reclusive hacker who uncovers a vast conspiracy and must learn to trust others to expose it.
archetypes.motivation: To solve the ultimate puzzle.
archetypes.flaw: Incapable of normal human interaction.

archetypes.name: The Grizzled Ship Captain
archetypes.description: The captain of a cargo ship navigating the treacherous waters off the coast of West Africa, smuggling more than just goods.
archetypes.motivation: To complete one last job and retire.
archetypes.flaw: Haunted by the memory of a crew he lost at sea.

archetypes.name: The Tomb Raider
archetypes.description: A daring adventurer who plunders ancient tombs for treasure, but awakens an ancient curse in a newly discovered pyramid.
archetypes.motivation: Fortune and glory.
archetypes.flaw: Sees history as something to be sold, not preserved.

archetypes.name: The Mercenary with a Code
archetypes.description: A soldier-for-hire who will do any job for the right price, except for one: harming the innocent.
archetypes.motivation: To make a living in the only way they know how.
archetypes.flaw: Their 'code' is flexible when the price is high enough.

archetypes.name: The Political Activist
archetypes.description: A charismatic student leader organizing protests against a corrupt government, who must decide how far they are willing to go for revolution.
archetypes.motivation: To create a better future for their people.
archetypes.flaw: Sees every issue in black and white.

archetypes.name: The Hard-boiled Detective
archetypes.description: A classic, cynical private investigator in a rain-soaked city, who takes on a seemingly simple case that spirals into a web of lies and murder.
archetypes.motivation: To find the truth, no matter how ugly it is.
archetypes.flaw: A weakness for a pretty face and a sad story.

archetypes.name: The Star-Crossed Lovers
archetypes.description: Two people from warring families or factions who fall in love, forcing them to choose between their loyalty and their hearts.
archetypes.motivation: To be together against all odds.
archetypes.flaw: They believe their love can conquer anything, including centuries of hatred.

archetypes.name: The Unassuming Assassin
archetypes.description: The most feared killer in the world is someone no one would ever suspect: a quiet librarian, a friendly baker, or a lonely schoolteacher.
archetypes.motivation: To maintain their secret life and identity.
archetypes.flaw: A longing for a normal life they can never have.

archetypes.name: The Mad Scientist
archetypes.description: An ambitious inventor whose creations defy the laws of nature, but who is branded a heretic by the scientific community.
archetypes.motivation: To push the boundaries of human knowledge.
archetypes.flaw: Ignores the ethical implications of their work.

archetypes.name: The Fading God
archetypes.description: An ancient deity whose power is waning as their believers dwindle, who must find a new source of faith in the modern world to survive.
archetypes.motivation: To not be forgotten.
archetypes.flaw: Pride and an inability to adapt to the modern world.

archetypes.name: The Determined Athlete
archetypes.description: An underdog athlete from a small Nigerian town who dreams of competing on the world stage, facing incredible odds and personal sacrifice.
archetypes.motivation: To bring honor to their family and community.
archetypes.flaw: Pushes their body past its limits, risking permanent injury.

sensory_palette.smell: The mix of new electronics, dust, and sweat.
sensory_palette.sound: A cacophony of haggling voices, Nollywood film soundtracks, and generator roars.
sensory_palette.sight: An endless maze of stalls overflowing with goods under a tin roof.

sensory_palette.smell: The dry, earthy scent of dust and the faint aroma of distant woodsmoke.
sensory_palette.sound: The whistling of the wind and the bleating of goats.
sensory_palette.sight: A hazy, reddish sun hanging over low, flat-roofed buildings.

locations.name: An abandoned colonial-era hospital in Calabar

sensory_palette.smell: The sterile scent of antiseptic that never quite left, mixed with damp decay.
sensory_palette.sound: The wind whistling through broken window panes like a faint moan.
sensory_palette.sight: Peeling paint, rusted medical equipment, and long, shadow-filled corridors.

locations.name: The opulent court of a medieval Oba

sensory_palette.smell: The rich scent of incense, palm oil, and polished bronze.
sensory_palette.sound: The rhythmic beat of ceremonial drums and the murmur of courtiers.
sensory_palette.sight: Intricately carved ivory, vibrant woven textiles, and the gleam of coral beads.

locations.name: A traffic jam on the Third Mainland Bridge

sensory_palette.smell: The sharp sting of exhaust fumes and the salty air of the Lagos Lagoon.
sensory_palette.sound: A chorus of car horns, street hawkers' calls, and music blasting from a danfo bus.
sensory_palette.sight: A seemingly infinite line of cars shimmering under the oppressive sun.

internal.text: a crisis of conscience over a necessary evil.
a love they cannot admit for fear of destroying a family.
the temptation of a forbidden power they know could solve all their problems.

external.text: a political rival who knows their darkest secret.
a family feud that spans generations and demands a blood price.
an impending natural disaster that only they know is coming.
a viral TikTok challenge exposes his offshore slush fund, forcing him to dodge international sanctions with a PR stunt.
his fintech app crashes nationwide during a cash crunch, sparking a class-action lawsuit from broke Gen Z hustlers.
climate-fueled floods submerge a sacred grove, pitting him against eco-activists demanding he 'modernize' traditions.

objects.name: a diary written in a forgotten dialect
a visa to a better life that requires an impossible choice
a piece of technology that can record dreams

caseStudies.author: Chinua Achebe
caseStudies.element_value: A crippling fear of being perceived as weak.
caseStudies.insight: This singular flaw drives every major decision the protagonist makes, leading to his tragic downfall.

caseStudies.author: Wole Soyinka
caseStudies.element_value: The conflict between performative tradition and genuine modernity.
caseStudies.insight: Soyinka uses characters not just as symbols, but to satirize how both tradition and progress can be twisted by arrogance.

caseStudies.author: Buchi Emecheta
caseStudies.element_value: The struggle between personal identity and the crushing weight of societal expectations.
caseStudies.insight: The protagonist's internal desires are constantly at odds with the role she is forced to play, showing that the greatest conflicts are often within.

caseStudies.author: George Orwell
caseStudies.element_value: A totalitarian society under constant surveillance.
caseStudies.insight: The setting is not just a backdrop; it is the primary force working against the protagonist, making the environment itself the villain.

caseStudies.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
caseStudies.element_value: The green light at the end of the dock.
caseStudies.insight: An object can be a powerful, recurring symbol for a character's unattainable dream, hope, or longing.
